title: How to Download Xbox Games

methods.name: Downloading Games from the Xbox Games Store

steps.headline: Sign into Xbox Live with the account that you want to make the purchase with.
steps.description: Click here for instructions on creating a free Xbox Live account. You don't need a Gold Account to purchase and download games.

steps.headline: Open the "games" tab on the Xbox dashboard.
Select "Browse Games" to open the Xbox Games Store.
steps.description: If you're using an Xbox One, select the "Store" tab and select "Games".

steps.headline: Browse or search for the game you want to purchase.
steps.description: Games will be organized into a variety of categories, or you can search for a specific title. There are a bunch of free demos available on the Xbox 360 that you can download without a credit card, as well as some free-to-play games (though these aren't sorted into a free-to-play category). If you have an Xbox Live Gold account, there will be free games available for you to download each month.

steps.headline: Confirm that you want to purchase the game.
steps.description: If you don't have enough money in your Xbox Live account wallet (from redeeming a card), you'll be asked to select a payment method. The available payment method varies depending on your region. If you've previously purchased the game, you can begin downloading it immediately.

steps.headline: Wait for your game to download.
steps.description: Your Xbox 360 will download one title at a time if you have multiple games queued. Games range in size from a few hundred megabytes to tens of gigabytes, so the time it takes to download will depend on the game.

methods.name: Purchasing Games from the Xbox Website

steps.headline: Visit the Xbox Marketplace in your web browser.
steps.description: You can reach it at marketplace.xbox.com.

steps.headline: Sign in with your Xbox Live account.
steps.description: Make sure it's the same account associated with your Xbox console.

steps.headline: Hold your cursor over the "Games" tab and select your console.
steps.description: You can purchase Xbox 360 and Xbox One games from the website.

steps.headline: Browse or search for the game you want to purchase.
steps.description: Games will be organized into a variety of categories, or you can search for a specific title. There are a bunch of free demos available on the Xbox 360 that you can download without a credit card, as well as some free-to-play games (though these aren't sorted into a free-to-play category). If you have an Xbox Live Gold account, there will be free games available for you to download each month.

steps.headline: Click "Buy Game" for the game you want.
steps.description: You'll be asked to confirm that you want to purchase the game. If you have money in your Xbox Live account's wallet, that will be used to purchase the game. If you don't you will need to provide another payment method. If you've previously purchased the game, you can begin downloading it immediately. Even if the game is free, you will need to "Buy" it to confirm that you are adding it to your account.

steps.headline: Confirm that the game is downloading to your console.
steps.description:
If you purchase an Xbox One game, it will begin downloading automatically as long as your Xbox One is connected to the internet. For the Xbox 360, you'll want to check your download queue:
Click the "My Account" link underneath your profile name after purchasing the game. Click the "Manage devices" option. Select "Xbox 360 Download Queue". This will display all of the items set to download to your console. You can adjust the order if you'd like.

steps.headline: Mod your Xbox 360.
steps.description: In order to play downloaded copies of Xbox 360 games, you'll need to mod your Xbox 360 console. This is against the Xbox Live terms and you could get your account banned if caught. Click here for instructions on modding your Xbox 360. It is not currently possible to mod the Xbox One.

steps.headline: Find a torrent file for the backup you want to download.
steps.description: Torrents are the most common way to share game backups. Be wary when downloading torrents, as they are often targets for viruses. Downloading backups of games that you do not own is illegal, and even if you do own it it's a legal gray area. Click here for details on downloading torrent files.

steps.headline: Download ABGX360.
steps.description: This is a program that will "patch" the backup file that you've downloaded so that you can connect to Xbox Live and play online. If you don't perform this patching process, you should not connect your Xbox 360 to the internet. You can download ABGX360 from abgx360.xecuter.com/

steps.headline: Patch the game with ABGX360.
steps.description: Start ABGX360 to begin the patching process. The patching process will help fool Xbox Live into thinking you're playing with a legitimate copy of the game, and not a backup. Not all games can be successfully patched with ABGX360. Select the ISO file that you downloaded in the "Input" section. Click the AutoFix tab and change the AutoFix Threshold from Level 2 to Level 3. Click the Misc tab and select the region that you connect your Xbox 360 to. Click the "Launch" button to begin patching. A new window will appear displaying the patching process. If the game fails verification, you can still play it but you should not connect your console to Xbox Live when the disc is inserted.

steps.headline: Download ImgBurn.
steps.description: You will need a burning program that allows you to burn .ISO and .DVD files. You won't be able to use Windows' built-in burning software, as you will need to adjust some settings. ImgBurn is one of the more popular free choices.

steps.headline: Open the newly created .DVD file in ImgBurn.
steps.description: This file was created by ABGX360, and will be located in the same location as the .ISO file that you downloaded.

steps.headline: Click "Tools" → "Settings".
steps.description: In the Write tab, find the "Layer Break" section. Set it to "User Specified" and enter 1913760 into the field.

steps.headline: Insert a blank DVD-R. Make sure that it is a high-quality brand such as Memorex or Verbatim, as low-quality DVD-Rs tend to fail during the burning process.
Start the burn process and lower the write speed.
steps.description: Click the "Burn" button and then lower the "Write Speed" to 2 or 2.4x. This will help ensure that no errors occur during the burning process, which is highly error-prone when burning Xbox 360 games.

steps.headline: Play your burned game.
steps.description: Now that the game has been burned to disc, you should be able to play it in your modded Xbox 360. If your game did not pass the verification process, do not connect your Xbox 360 to the internet will playing. When a game doesn't pass verification, Microsoft will be able to tell that you're playing a burned game, and you Xbox Live account will be banned.

text:
Downloading Games from the Xbox Games Store Sign into Xbox Live with the account that you want to make the purchase with. Click here for instructions on creating a free Xbox Live account. You don't need a Gold Account to purchase and download games. Open the "games" tab on the Xbox dashboard.  Select "Browse Games" to open the Xbox Games Store. If you're using an Xbox One, select the "Store" tab and select "Games". Browse or search for the game you want to purchase. Games will be organized into a variety of categories, or you can search for a specific title. There are a bunch of free demos available on the Xbox 360 that you can download without a credit card, as well as some free-to-play games (though these aren't sorted into a free-to-play category). If you have an Xbox Live Gold account, there will be free games available for you to download each month. Confirm that you want to purchase the game. If you don't have enough money in your Xbox Live account wallet (from redeeming a card), you'll be asked to select a payment method. The available payment method varies depending on your region. If you've previously purchased the game, you can begin downloading it immediately. Wait for your game to download. Your Xbox 360 will download one title at a time if you have multiple games queued. Games range in size from a few hundred megabytes to tens of gigabytes, so the time it takes to download will depend on the game. Purchasing Games from the Xbox Website Visit the Xbox Marketplace in your web browser. You can reach it at marketplace.xbox.com. Sign in with your Xbox Live account. Make sure it's the same account associated with your Xbox console. Hold your cursor over the "Games" tab and select your console. You can purchase Xbox 360 and Xbox One games from the website. Browse or search for the game you want to purchase. Games will be organized into a variety of categories, or you can search for a specific title. There are a bunch of free demos available on the Xbox 360 that you can download without a credit card, as well as some free-to-play games (though these aren't sorted into a free-to-play category). If you have an Xbox Live Gold account, there will be free games available for you to download each month. Click "Buy Game" for the game you want. You'll be asked to confirm that you want to purchase the game. If you have money in your Xbox Live account's wallet, that will be used to purchase the game. If you don't you will need to provide another payment method. If you've previously purchased the game, you can begin downloading it immediately. Even if the game is free, you will need to "Buy" it to confirm that you are adding it to your account. Confirm that the game is downloading to your console. If you purchase an Xbox One game, it will begin downloading automatically as long as your Xbox One is connected to the internet. For the Xbox 360, you'll want to check your download queue:
Click the "My Account" link underneath your profile name after purchasing the game. Click the "Manage devices" option. Select "Xbox 360 Download Queue". This will display all of the items set to download to your console. You can adjust the order if you'd like. Downloading Game Backups Mod your Xbox 360. In order to play downloaded copies of Xbox 360 games, you'll need to mod your Xbox 360 console. This is against the Xbox Live terms and you could get your account banned if caught. Click here for instructions on modding your Xbox 360. It is not currently possible to mod the Xbox One. Find a torrent file for the backup you want to download. Torrents are the most common way to share game backups. Be wary when downloading torrents, as they are often targets for viruses. Downloading backups of games that you do not own is illegal, and even if you do own it it's a legal gray area. Click here for details on downloading torrent files. Download ABGX360. This is a program that will "patch" the backup file that you've downloaded so that you can connect to Xbox Live and play online. If you don't perform this patching process, you should not connect your Xbox 360 to the internet. You can download ABGX360 from abgx360.xecuter.com/ Patch the game with ABGX360. Start ABGX360 to begin the patching process. The patching process will help fool Xbox Live into thinking you're playing with a legitimate copy of the game, and not a backup. Not all games can be successfully patched with ABGX360. Select the ISO file that you downloaded in the "Input" section. Click the AutoFix tab and change the AutoFix Threshold from Level 2 to Level 3. Click the Misc tab and select the region that you connect your Xbox 360 to. Click the "Launch" button to begin patching. A new window will appear displaying the patching process. If the game fails verification, you can still play it but you should not connect your console to Xbox Live when the disc is inserted. Download ImgBurn. You will need a burning program that allows you to burn .ISO and .DVD files. You won't be able to use Windows' built-in burning software, as you will need to adjust some settings. ImgBurn is one of the more popular free choices. Open the newly created .DVD file in ImgBurn. This file was created by ABGX360, and will be located in the same location as the .ISO file that you downloaded. Click "Tools" → "Settings". In the Write tab, find the "Layer Break" section. Set it to "User Specified" and enter 1913760 into the field. Insert a blank DVD-R. Make sure that it is a high-quality brand such as Memorex or Verbatim, as low-quality DVD-Rs tend to fail during the burning process.  Start the burn process and lower the write speed. Click the "Burn" button and then lower the "Write Speed" to 2 or 2.4x. This will help ensure that no errors occur during the burning process, which is highly error-prone when burning Xbox 360 games. Play your burned game. Now that the game has been burned to disc, you should be able to play it in your modded Xbox 360. If your game did not pass the verification process, do not connect your Xbox 360 to the internet will playing. When a game doesn't pass verification, Microsoft will be able to tell that you're playing a burned game, and you Xbox Live account will be banned.
